text: Can anyone tell me, how get all Deals inside a certain dealstage?
Cant find the api
This seems to be an ask-only channel?

<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/hubdb/v2/get_table_rows>

I am curious if HubDB get_table_row api can return data orderBy based on combination of first two character instead of one ?

I haven't done exactly this but using either the batch read or the search endpoint in the deals API should work. If using the batch read then passing the deal stage as an id property, or when using the search endpoint then creating a filter doing the same should work. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/deals>
Hello can anyone let me know what's the API name of the Field Subtotal in Quote Module!!
Anyone?
<@U039FTRBQ93> Seems like the @ domain does not show up in dns search so HubSpot entry is not appearing. Can you suggest any other dns search tool?
of course
Very interesting, let me know what you find
Is there a way to pay for increasing the 500k API daily limit?
there is an API addon you can buy
thanks Andreas!
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/usage-details>
when calculating the price, its something that you can select at the bottom
is there a link to that page or is it internal to HubSpot?
its the normal pricing page, then click on "Bundle" and "Configure Bundle"
then you can  select it
thank you!

Sorry for the delay. Yeah. Regarding the tables, I’m just referring to the ‘crm::table’ component in the CRM development. There’s limited ability to customize it (like filtering for only records associated to the record you’re on). However, in UI, under Settings -> Object, there’s a link that says “Customize association tables”. When I saw that, I thought I could use that, but that capability only exists via the UI to my knowledge.

This is a symptom of a larger problem I’m dealing with though - that there’s not parity between the UI and the API. We need to be able to do a myriad of operations programmatically that we can’t, including, but not limited to the one mentioned above, setting field-level permissions, being able to read workflows, etc.

Does that clear anything up? More than happy to jump on a call! :)
Just seeing these! Thanks, Carter!
Of course

<@U04E5EW89AM> Thanks for mentioning. So we can manage webhooks via that API endpoint, but I’m more looking for general workflow management via the API, beyond exclusively webhooks. Is what I’m looking for what you’re saying you’re able to do via that endpoint? No worries, if not! Either way, I appreciate you helping!

Hey Folks, I want to make a call in the "Get all deals" API, aparently I need to creat a ObjectType for that, but even though I have found documentation about I'm still a bit lost on the subject. Would like a call with the engineering team to figure this out.

Can I please get support on the matter?

Thanks,

Hello everyone :smile:

i got a question, i want to update a property of a contact that is inside contact information which is State/Region using the request inside <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>

there is an issue though, let's say i have the following JSON to PATCH for a contact based on contactId:

`{`
    `"city": "test",`
    `"country": "test",`
    `"state": "test"`
`}`

the properties city and country get updated correctly but state does not(The 2nd image showing Greater London was manually added, not added from the API)

does someone know the name for the State/Region property that works in the JSON properties parameter for the PATCH request to update a contact? thanks in advance :grin:
`state is the correct name for that property are you sure you're looking at the correct contact?
The id at the end of the request url should match the id in the url of the contact's page in HubSpot
i could try on an individual contact rn, i was running it in a test of 10 contacts and everyone updated properly except state
1 sec please :smile:
no problem

it did work :exploding_head:, it did now and not in my demo :sweat_smile: , well it helps to always double verify, maybe it is something in the way i made the JSON at that time

Thank you so much for the help :grin:
of course

Hey, thanks for the reply.
I "solved it", the problem was that I was searching something that didn't exist in my account
HI <@U04EFF323TL> Yes i can help you with the End point API
Well, perhaps <http://intodns.com|intodns.com> could shed some light, but it won't list every DNS entry
If not, perhaps you could use nslookup (on any machine's command prompt) to see if the entries are correctly set, <@U04FJ79G6AF>
